qas.question: What color silk covered Bell's kites?
Who was on Cygnet I when it crashed?
Bell's kits were flown from 1907 to what year?
How many tetrahedral wings did Bell create?
Some of the kites remain at what National Historic Site?

context: In 1898, Bell experimented with tetrahedral box kites and wings constructed of multiple compound tetrahedral kites covered in <a0_0>maroon<a0_0/> silk.[N 2<a3_0>3<a3_0/>] The tetrahedral wings were named Cygnet I, II and III, and were flown both unmanned and manned (Cygnet I crashed during a flight carrying <a1_0>Selfridge<a1_0/>) in the period from 1907–<a2_0>1912<a2_0/>. Some of Bell's kites are on display at the <a4_0>Alexander Graham Bell<a4_0/> National Historic Site.
